intro: Peucedanum multivittatum f. linearilobum, commonly known as the narrow-lobed lovage, is a variant of the lovage plant characterized by its slender, elongated leaves. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes many aromatic herbs such as parsley and carrots. The plant features finely divided, linear leaves that give it a delicate appearance, and it produces small, yellowish-green flowers in umbels. Its botanical structure supports its use in traditional medicine and as a culinary herb. The f. linearilobum form is distinguished by its unique leaf morphology compared to the typical variety.
